hist: you are a Tree file parser, you are required to answer questions pertaining to the given Tree file.

In this question, you are given a binary tree and you are asked to find the height of the root node and the number of edges in the longest path from the root node to any leaf node.

Let's represent this binary tree with an array, starting from the root node:

[root](root->node[0])[0](node[0]->node[1])node[1](node[1]->node[2])node[2](node[2]->node[3])node[3](node[3]->node[4])node[4](node[4]->leaf)

Height of the root node is 0.

To find the longest path from the root node to any leaf node, we follow the path until we reach a leaf node or reach the end of the array.

In this case, the longest path is from the root node to leaf node "wb->zb". It has 7 edges.

So, the answer is 7.

Please note that this answer assumes that leaf nodes have height 0. If this is not the case, you may need to adjust the answer accordingly.
